tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE SecurityPatches (
  patch_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  patch_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  patch_description VARCHAR(255),
  patch_version VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  release_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE patch_vulnerability_mapping (
	patch_id INT,
	vulnerability_id INT,
	PRIMARY KEY (patch_id, vulnerability_id),
	FOREIGN KEY (patch_id) REFERENCES security_patches(patch_id),
	FOREIGN KEY (vulnerability_id) REFERENCES vulnerability_list(vulnerability_id)
);
CREATE TABLE security_patches (patch_id INT PRIMARY KEY, patch_name VARCHAR(255), patch_description TEXT, patch_date TIMESTAMP);
CREATE TABLE vulnerabilities (vuln_id INT PRIMARY KEY, vuln_name VARCHAR(255), vuln_description TEXT, vuln_severity INT);
CREATE TABLE patch_history (history_id INT PRIMARY KEY, patch_id INT, applied_date TIMESTAMP, status VARCHAR(50));
CREATE TABLE patch_logs (log_id INT PRIMARY KEY, patch_id INT, user_id INT, action_taken VARCHAR(100), action_date TIMESTAMP);
Regularly updating database security patches to protect against known vulnerabilities
